greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangular array read by rows: T(n,k) = number of partitions of n into distinct parts in which every part is >=k, for k=1,2,...,n.
comment: A219922(n) = smallest number of row containing n. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Dec 01 2012
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Rows n = 1..120 of triangle, flattened
formula: T(n, k) = 1 + Sum(T(i, j): i>=j>k and i+j=n+1). - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jan 01 2003
T(n, k) > 1 iff 2*k < n. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jan 01 2003
mathematica: Nest[Function[{T, n, r}, Append[T, Table[1 + Total[T[[##]] & @@@ Select[r, #[[-1]] > k + 1 &]], {k, 0, n}]]] @@ {#1, #2, Transpose[1 + {#2 - #3, #3}]} & @@ {#1, #2, Range[Ceiling[#2/2] - 1]} & @@ {#, Length@ #} &, {{1}}, 12] // Flatten (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Aug 03 2020 *)
program: (\row -> map (p $ last row) $ init $ tails row) a002260_tabl
p m (k:ks) = if m < k then 0 else p (m - k) ks + p m ks
results.author: _Clark Kimberling_
